content.description:
This steep route is located on the SW corner of the rock and enjoys some late evening rays away from the crowded west face.  You can belay from the ground, but a 4th class approach will deposit you on a ledge below the climb.

Follow "white huecos" through overhanging rock.  There are a number of route finding cruxes, which add to the pump factor. The third bolt is poorly placed and levers your biner open, so be careful. You can place some optional gear along the way, and you should consider an anchor if you belay on the upper ledge system.
content.protection: bolts, optional green alien, #0.75 camalot, and #1 camalot
content.location: White Hueco's starts up on a ledge system on the SW side of the rock.

content.description:
A good route that climbs a heavily featured arete.

Trickier than it looks, the aesthetic

Prey for Me

ascends an ever steepening face using shallow pockets and mis-leading patina edges. Awkward and off-balance,

Prey for Me

keeps you alert! Not a gimmie for the grade.
content.protection: Six or Seven bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location:
Set on the backside of

Bath Rock

,

Prey for Me

sits high on a ledge well above the crag floor. Scramble in from the southwest corner climbing up fourth class rock to gain a ledge at the base of the climb. The route is the bolted line on prominent SW corner.

content.description: Powerful sustained climbing on not-always-so-positive huecos. Body tension useful on this one!
content.protection: Bolts to a two-bolt chain anchor.
content.location: To start, scramble up to a ledge high on the rock to the left of "White Huecos".  Look for dark patinaed huecos.

content.description: Wander up the slab or traverse from climber's left to the base of the route which starts in a left-facing corner with a small crack in the back. You then traverse up and right along a 3-4 foot crack to another short crack/small corner that leads to the bottom of the face/pillar that takes you to the top.
content.protection: Small gear in some questionable placements. There is one bolt one the face towards the top. Guidebook indicates anchors at the top but I didn't see them. This can be top-roped by using natural protection in horizontal cracks up top but I don't know the length of rope needed if one wants to belay a TR from the bottom.
content.location: This route is situated left of White Huecos and right of Calamari on the southwest side of Bath Rock. This section of climbs is situated to climber's right of the Rebar Route.
